text:
I have a virtualhost on a test server that defines the following filters:

<Directory /foo>
AddOutputFilter INCLUDES html
AddOutputFilter INCLUDES shtml
AddOutputFilter DEFLATE html
AddOutputFilter DEFLATE shtml
</Directory>

When the deflate filter is in place, mod_include only does ONE pass over the 
includes, ie, any <!--#include's in the included files are ignored. 

Without the deflate filter, it acts as 1.3.x did, which is to recurse on all 
includes until no more can be expanded.

my 1.3.x uses mod_gzip, which does not interfere with mod_include
creator: jay@grue.userfriendly.org
jwoolley@apache.org
text:
Two things: first, make sure Options Includes is on.  Second, try using: 
 
  AddOutputFilter INCLUDES;DEFLATE shtml 
  AddOutputFilter INCLUDES;DEFLATE html 
 
But at any rate, if this problem did exist in 2.0.35 (I wouldn't be surprised due to some 
of the subrequest confusions that existed in 2.0.35), it doesn't exist anymore... I just 
tested it on 2.0.36 and it worked fine. 
 
Thanks for using Apache!
